titleStmt.title: To the Worshipfull, his most approued Friend, Mr. Robert Nicolson.
titleStmt.author: Arcto-Phylos,

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: To the Worshipfull, his most approued Friend, Mr. Robert Nicolson.
analytic.author: Arcto-Phylos,

monogr.title: The vvood-mans bear : A poeme. By Io. Syluester
monogr.author: Sylvester, Josuah

div.head: To the Worshipfull, his most approued Friend, Mr. Robert Nicolson.

lg.l: SIR, the kind welcome that you alwaies daigne
To the faire Muses, and their fauorites;
And chiefly me, the meanest of their traine,
(Too meane to meddle with their sacred rites)▪
My willing heart with thankefull hand inuites,
To offer you my busie-idle paine,
Il-shapen shaddowes of my yong delights,
Till better fruits my better Fates ordaine.
Yet (pray you) priuate let this Gigge be kept;
Which but for you, eternally had slept,
And, but to you, from henceforth euer dies:
But lacke of better, forst me for a shift,
To bring you now this old new New-yeeres gift.
